content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs a system, I have not received any new commands. However, the user executed a command to browse a website about the concept of time step in numerical analysis. The first website did not provide a clear definition, but the second website focused on numerical integration methods and the history of quadrature. The user asked "What is a time step in numerical analysis?" and received answers from two websites, but neither provided a clear definition. \n\nAs for the latest development, the user executed a command to browse a website about time step in numerical analysis. The website did not provide a clear definition, but instead provided information about Simulink, a block diagram environment for multidomain simulation and Model-Based Design. The website also mentioned the collection and processing of personal data for personalized ads and content.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Numerical_integration#Quadrature_rules", "question": "What is a time step in numerical analysis?"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text does not provide a direct definition or answer to the question about a time step in numerical analysis. It discusses numerical integration methods, including step size or interval width between evaluation points in quadrature rules. The text also mentions various techniques for integrating over unbounded intervals and multidimensional integrals, as well as the connection between evaluating integrals and solving ordinary differential equations using methods such as Runge-Kutta. \n \n Links: ['Jump to content (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Numerical_integration#bodyContent)', 'Main page (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page)', 'Contents (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents)', 'Current events (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events)', 'Random article (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Random)']"}]
"""
